channel.title: Consulting on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Consulting on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: What's New in February 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Reporting Tech Signals - Latest findings on Serverless Computing, AI & ML, FinOps and CyberSecurity Research Topics 2024 - 40 topics on the most promising technologies.

item.title: What's new in December
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before you dive in Dwarves is operated as a 50% company, 50% community. Everything we learn along the way of work, we transform into knowledge and distribute back to our tech community.

item.title: Consultant Growth Track
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: While there is no fixed path in the consulting field, we do have a structured growth guidance for career development, skill enhancement, and professional advancement.

item.title: Consulting - How we work
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Our Approach: Collaborative Expertise Team of Specialists: we favor collective expertise, encouraging knowledge sharing and collaboration, to craft innovative solutions that exceed expectations.

item.title: Consulting - Who should join us
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Consulting teams consists of anyone who’s hungry for more than just coding; those who are curious about the trends, the market, who can introduce new projects / challenges, who care about providing sensible solutions, and who take great care of projects.

item.title: Consulting - Who We Are
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Who we are Dwarves Consulting is team of individuals who possess a combination of technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and strong communication abilities.

item.title: Consulting Team
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Who we are Dwarves Consulting is team of individuals who possess a combination of technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and strong communication abilities.

item.title: Estimation Guidelines
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: When we conduct an estimation, it is recommended to abandon the transitional “exact hours” assessment method, instead, use the story point based on the Fibonacci number (1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21…).

item.title: Project Delivery Schedule and Guidelines
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Weekly Activities Weekly Points/Effort Report Every Friday Action: Fill out the weekly points/effort report. Link: Weekly Report Spreadsheet. Deadline for Data Sync: Data is sync by EOD next Tuesday.

item.title: fbsc
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Budget We do need to know clients’ budgets. This is often uncomfortable for them but their budget helps determines what scope is possible.

item.title: how-to-work-with-clients
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: TRAINING COURSE: HOW TO WORK WITH CLIENT What skills that an engineer should have in order to work with client effectively?

item.title: service-feedbacks
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: GENERAL QUESTIONS FOR SERVICE FEEDBACKS Engineer performances a. Communication How did the engineer interact with your team? How was the communication between the engineer and your team?

item.title: Setting The Budget
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: One of the most important questions at the start of a project is how much it will cost. It is vital to make sure that enough budget is available to allow for the development of a viable product.

item.title: Fixed Budget Scope Controlled
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC) is applied at Atomic Object. They build custom software for our customers. Because of the complexity involved in building a great software product, software development projects are always more difficult to price than a product.
